description:
Capronia epimyces CBS 606.96 is a species of fungus that belongs to the genus Capronia. Capronia is a genus of ascomycete fungi that are typically found in soil or as epiphytes on the surfaces of plants.

The specific strain, CBS 606.96, was isolated and deposited in the Centraalbureau voor Schimmelcultures (CBS) culture collection. This strain may have been studied for its morphological, genetic, or physiological characteristics, but without more detailed information, a comprehensive scientific description is limited.

In general, Capronia species are known to produce dark-colored, often hairy or bristly perithecia (fruiting bodies) that contain asci and ascospores as their reproductive structures. The mycelium and other vegetative structures of Capronia species can exhibit a range of colors and growth patterns depending on the specific species and environmental conditions.

However, to provide a more detailed scientific description of the Capronia epimyces CBS 606.96 strain, additional information about its specific morphological features, genetic makeup, ecological niche, or any unique physiological properties would be needed.
